name: David Zhigang Pan
content: David Z. Pan's Home Page David Z. Pan, Fellow of ACM, IEEE, SPIE Professor, Silicon Labs Endowed Chair Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering Affiliated Faculty, Computer Science Department The University of Texas at Austin Email: dpan at ece.utexas.edu Office: EER 4.880. Tel: 512-471-1436. Office hours: M 1:30-2:30pm, Th 2-3pm, and by appointment Biography and CV Recent News 9/22/2025: Congrats to my former PhD student Keren Zhu (PhD 2022) for being named ğŒğˆğ“ ğ“ğğœğ¡ğ§ğ¨ğ¥ğ¨ğ ğ² ğ‘ğğ¯ğ¢ğğ°â€™ğ¬ ğˆğ§ğ§ğ¨ğ¯ğšğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ¬ ğ”ğ§ğğğ« 35 (TR35) ğ€ğ¬ğ¢ğš ğğšğœğ¢ğŸğ¢ğœ 2025! 5/10/2025: Our paper "APOLLO: SGD-like Memory, AdamW-level Performance" was recognized as an Honorable Mention Outstand Paper at MLSys 2025! 7/25/2024: Congratulations to Shupeng Ning (co-supervised with Prof. Ray Chen) for winning the Robert S. Hilbert Memorial Optical Design Competition. 6/25/2024: Congratulations to UTDA alumnus Prof. Bei Yu for winning the prestigious DAC Under-40 Innovators Award. 5/29/2024: UTDA team (Souradip and co-authors) won the Poster Competition 1st Place at the Annual SRC CADT Review. 5/7/2024: Our FCCM 2024 paper "A Data-Driven, Congestion-Aware and Open-Source Timing-Driven FPGA Placer Accelerated by GPUs" won the Best Paper Award! Congratulations to Zhili and Rachel! 4/7/2024: Congratulations to my former PhD student Jiaqi Gu (co-advised by Prof. Ray Chen) for winning the UT Austin-wide Outstanding Dissertation Award in Mathematics, Engineering, Physical Sciences, and Biological and Life Sciences in 2024. Jiaqi is an Assistant Professor at ASU now. 11/28/2023: Congratulations to Hyunsu Chae for receiving Cadence Diversity in Technology Scholarship for 2023! 11/21/2023: Congratulations to Dr. Mark Haoxing Ren, UTDA alumnus and currently Director of Design Automation Research at Nvidia for his elevation to IEEE Fellow! 10/6/2023: UTDA team won the MLCAD FPGA Macro-Placement Conteste 1st Place! Great job, Zhili, Rachel, Zhixing, and Hanqing! 4/29/2023: I'm invited to serve in the External Advisory Board of NSF A3D3 Institute. More archival news at UTDA.
